qas.question: Zinc oxide is used to fortify what product?
In what product did  various compounds of zinc show little difference in absorption?
What compound is better absorbed than zinc gluconate?
What is the best absorbed dietary zinc compound?
What product is zinc oxide used to taint?
What product did various compounds of zinc show massive differences in absorption?
What compound is the same as zinc gluconate in being absorbed?
What is the only absorbed dietary zinc compound?
What year had the only study regarding zinc compounds?

context: For fortification, however, a 2003 review recommended zinc oxide in <a0_0><b4_0>cereals<b4_0/><a0_0/> as cheap, stable, and as easily absorbed as more expensive forms. A 2005 study found that various compounds of zinc, including oxide and sulfate, did not show statistically significant differences in absorption when added as fortificants to <a1_0><b5_0>maize tortillas<b5_0/><a1_0/>. A <b8_0>1987<b8_0/> study found that <a2_0><b6_0>zinc picolinate<b6_0/><a2_0/> was better absorbed than zinc gluconate or zinc citrate. However, a study published in 2008 determined that <a3_0><b7_0>zinc glycinate<b7_0/><a3_0/> is the best absorbed of the four dietary supplement types available.
